summary: A young graduate from a Bachelor program of International Business, who dived into the scientific world,  exploring its business perspective for over half year now. I am passionate about adding structure into a process that challenges me, delving into a completely new topic, learning and then finding the best approach. In combination with the organized and task-completion side of my personality, event coordinating for a Life Science company has been a great journey with an outlook to become more and more rewarding as the process improves. I am looking forward to supporting CytoSMART in its mission and developing my business understanding in application to the scientific research sphere.

treasury_media.title: CytoSMART Lux3 FL
treasury_media.description: The CytoSMART Lux3 FL is a small fluorescence live-cell imaging microscope equipped with one brightfield and two fluorescent channels (green and red). The device enables researchers to unravel cellular processes in real-time, providing lots of...

treasury_media.title: CytoSMART Omni
treasury_media.description: To help researchers in life sciences to continue improving their understanding of cellular processes, CytoSMART Technologies has developed an automated bright-field lab microscope that visualizes complete culture vessels and operates from inside standard CO2-incubators. Perform kinetic assays by creating time-lapse videos that capture cellular behavior for days or even weeks at a time.

treasury_media.title: CytoSMART Lux2
treasury_media.description: The CytoSMART Lux2 provides an easy and cost-effective solution for time-lapse imaging. Monitor cell proliferation, motility and morphology for hours up to weeks at a time. The CytoSMART Lux2 is a compact inverted lab microscope for bright-field live cell imaging. It works from inside any standard CO2-incubator and can be used in routine cell culture processes.

treasury_media.title: Organoid counting by CytoSMART & Corning
treasury_media.description: Together with Corning®, CytoSMART already introduced an automated cell counter for counting of mammalian cells called the Corning® Cell Counter. A new, powerful and simple software application has been developed that enables organoid counting with the Corning® Cell Counter.

education.degree_name: Bachelor of Applied Science - BASc (Erasmus Exchange Program)

school.name: Lycée de langue francaise "Antoine de Saint-Exupery"​

projects.title: Consultancy project
projects.description: The team is facing the challenge of dedicating to a particular company and a problem they have for 17 weeks. In this time frame the group has to conduct extensive research in different fields and eventually  come up with applicable solutions in the short term. The customer we are currently working with is Inkijkmuseum, Eindhoven and we are happy to cooperate with them.

contributors.headline: Account Manager for Eastern Europe at AxionBio & CytoSMART Technologies BV

projects.title: IPW - International Project week
projects.description: Three day long project, where student teams worked with real company representatives, conducting research on different topics, given by the company. My team worked with the case of Beurgsgebouw, Eindhoven, more specifically NBI and their need for middlemen partners and particularly buyers.

projects.title: Junior Entrepreneur
projects.description:
The project was dedicated to developing an idea for a new product and making a full explanation about it. By the usage of PESTLE analysis, out team evaluated on all aspects that may affect the fulfillment of the  potential product. Considering the area of performance, which was technology, we can to also develop an e-marketing strategy to promote and sell the product. At the end, at the Junior Entrepreneur market day, we all presented our ideas to real company representatives that assessed us judging by our product presentation.
The project gave us know-how and wide knowledge about all stages of developing a new product and releasing it to the public.

profile_positions.description: I started to work in financial administration just as support due to less workload in my other position. Getting back to another part of my university background, I quickly adjusted to this more structured and organized position that requires an eye for detail and systematic planning - something I specifically enjoy in my day-to-day work and I also believe am good at. Therefore my desire for a full switch. My current position includes supplier (&production specific) invoice processing and handling, debtors management, bank mutations handling and general financial administration maintenance.  My responsibility is to keep the financial module of our ERP system fully updated for my colleagues who do the financial planning and reporting based on monthly figures. This role requires week to week discipline and attention to detail as well as active communication with all our departments and customers regarding payment matters.
profile_positions.title: Financial Administrator

profile_positions.description:
CytoSMART Technologies, an Axion Bio company, is based in the tech hub of Europe, Eindhoven. We introduce new smart imaging devices into laboratories worldwide. We want to challenge every life science researcher to think differently and become the best in their field of expertise. CytoSMART believes that high-end innovative tools should be accessible by all those trying to be at the forefront of scientific discovery. 

I have started as the event coordinator for CytoSMART Technologies as a fresh graduate ready to dive into the work world. I entered the company with many ideas and big ambitions to fulfil them. My position was technically project management looking at every event opportunity as a project that has to be lead from beginning until the end - a very diverse, dynamic and creative process, involving a great deal of communication and coordination which luckily I really enjoy. We had a strong start with a few attended and many booked scientific events, and a refreshed exposure approach. However, only half year after we had to readjust to a new world of digital events, due to the global pandemic. For almost one year I worked on virtual editions of scientific events until more capacity was temporarily needed in a different department of our company, which lead to my graduate shift across departments. I kept supporting the event position until a new colleague took over the position fully to allow my switch to finance.
profile_positions.title: Event Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
During this internship I was a part of the People&Culture department of Studyportals, which combines Recruitment, HR and Office Management. I was closely involved in all recruitment activities and was responsible for handling several open vacancies by myself. This involved tasks such as:
 - Job description development and posting
 - Working with a software recruitment tool to handle the candidate pipeline (Workable)
 - Reviewing CVs 
 - Performing screening calls with selected candidates
 - Coordinating the recruitment process and aligning with hiring managers
 - Keeping timely communication with candidates
 - Scheduling interviews in hiring managers' agendas
 - Conducting feedback meetings to align on candidate performance
 - Preparing administration for selected candidates - offer letters, contract, internship agreement, staff 
   registration form
 - Support HR activities and work on document templates
 - Keeping the company career page up to date and promote vacancies

Alongside this internship, I have been working on my graduation project, which was also related to the Recruitment team of Studyportals.
Title of graduation project: Improving retention by using social profiling and team compatibility testing during the recruitment process
 -
profile_positions.title: Recruiter (Internship)

profile_positions.description:
While being a study assistant for the first year students of the IB study program I was responsible for:
 - Organizing biweekly study meetings for revision, where every class was divided into groups who had a specific subject assigned to them and they had to present the highlights of the lectures throughout the past two weeks.
 - Keep track of attendance of student for the Study sessions
 - Organize a Walk-In hour when students can come and ask questions about homework, exams or assignments and provide them with the support needed.
 - Check and correct an e-book homework assignment, divided by blocks separately for each student per class and give them feedback on their work.
 - Coach projects groups for one of the courses and conduct a weekly meeting with all project groups assigned to report on their progress and support them in their work 
 - Attend pitching presentations and help with assessment
 - Support the faculty with some assessment administration.
profile_positions.title: Study assistant

profile_positions.description:
Qreer.com is a European Technical Job Board with a database of candidates from all over Europe. 
My responsibilities during my internship in Qreer were mainly to support the recruitment activities based on our customers request or vacancy. The tasks I was primarily involved in were:
 - Sourcing based on requirements per vacancy
 - Promoting job positions on different advertising and social media platforms
 - Screening CVs through different candidate databases and looking for a match with the customer request
 - Active communication and timely correspondence with candidates
 - Conducting screening interviews and preparing a summary of the candidate
 - Conducting a preparation session before the official interview with the company
 - Accompanying candidate to official interview
 - Going to company visits to discuss the vacancy opportunities
 - Keeping a database up-to-date based on the stage of each candidate
 - Source for companies open to international recruitment
 - Job posting and editing
 - Blog writing for the News page of the job board
 - Handling website updates or customer profile changes
profile_positions.title: Recruitment Consultant (Internship)

volunteer_experiences.description: Interact is a youth organization for organizing social and charity events. We had various projects such as concerts, sports competitions, literature related events, talent shows and so on. Volunteering as a vice-president there involved communication with members of the club and external parties, responsibilities for deadlines and announcement, representative role at meetings with other clubs.
